item.title: Three men found guilty and fined for performing Nazi salute outside Sydney Jewish museum
item.description: The trio were captured on CCTV performing Nazi salutes outside the Sydney Jewish Museum in Darlinghurst on October 13, less than a week after the deadly Hamas attack on Israel last year.

item.title: Critically endangered night parrot captured by Martu rangers in east Pilbara
item.description: After thousands of hours of recording, the elusive night parrot has been captured on camera drinking from a water hole for the first time, reshaping researchers' understanding of their needs.

item.title: Yancoal begins plans to extend life of central Queensland coal mine to 2070
item.description: Yancoal begins plans to extend the life of its central Queensland coal mine, which would see roughly 74 million tonnes of coal extracted over the life of the mine.

item.title: Oscar Piastri's journey from humble beginnings to the brink of the Formula One championship
item.description: After finishing last in his first race, Oscar Piastri has risen from humble beginnings to the brink of Australian sporting history as he chases his first F1 world title.

item.title: Oscar Piastri qualifies third for Abu Dhabi F1 Grand Prix, behind rivals Max Verstappen and Lando Norris
item.description: Oscar Piastri warns he's not out of the Formula One title hunt yet, even if many only now have eyes on a Lando Norris-Max Verstappen duel for the crown.

item.title: Lando Norris claims F1 world title after dramatic Abu Dhabi Grand Prix
item.description: Max Verstappen has won the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix ahead of Oscar Piastri, but Lando Norris finishes third to claim the world title.

item.title: Crops preferred to sheep in large parts of Australia's traditional mixed farming regions
item.description: Mixed farming, which involves growing crops and rearing livestock, used to be standard practice in Australia, but there are almost 100 million fewer sheep in Australia than there were 35 years ago.

item.title: Oscar Piastri praised as future formula 1 world champion by rivals
item.description: Oscar Piastri's chief rival, new formula 1 world champion Lando Norris, says the Australian will "get the better of me" after their tension-filled title race decider in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Canadian traditional owners fear Australian-style LNG development
item.description: Canadian hereditary chief Na'Moks wanted to find out what a gas pipeline on his land would look like, so he flew to northern Western Australia.

item.title: Rare brain illness could not stop Milly from making country netball history
item.description: A rare brain illness left Milly Brock unable to walk or speak, but eight months later, she was back leading her regional netball club on grand final day.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting gunman Naveed Akram was follower of pro-Islamic State preacher Wisam Haddad
item.description: At least one of the gunmen who killed 15 people in Sunday's Bondi Beach terrorist attack was known to authorities as a follower of a notorious Sydney pro-Islamic State cleric, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle and members of his family die in North Carolina plane crash
item.description: NASCAR icon Greg Biffle dies in a plane crash in the US, along with several family members.

item.title: Pilbara mining towns left out of government's battery rebate schemes
item.description: Residents in small Pilbara towns with power grids run by mining companies are excluded from home battery rebate schemes.

item.title: Newmont's Cadia Gold Mine to spend $300,000 on monitors after dust incidents
item.description: One of the country's largest gold mines in the NSW Central West will buy five new dust monitors after incidents at its tailings dam.

item.title: Canterbury-Bankstown Council shuts down prayer hall linked to notorious preacher Wisam Haddad
item.description: The City of Canterbury Bankstown Council says the site had been approved for use as a medical centre.

item.title: Bondi Beach gunmen's phone pinged near Philippine region known for Islamic extremism: police
item.description: Mobile phone data suggests the Bondi Beach gunmen may have travelled near a region in the Philippines where Islamic State-aligned militants could still be operating, a police source has told the ABC.

item.title: Endangered malleefowl chick saved in 2,000-hectare fire at Wyperfeld National Park
item.description: An endangered malleefowl chick has been saved from a 2,000-hectare bushfire in a regional Victorian national park.

item.title: Max Verstappen wins F1 Driver of the Year award for fifth straight year, Oscar Piastri comes fourth
item.description: Max Verstappen may not have won the F1 world title, but his fast finish to the year wins him Driver of the Year for the fifth straight year, while Oscar Piastri's disappointing end to the season is mirrored in the voting.

item.title: Four titan arum 'corpse flowers' to bloom in a week at Cairns Botanic Gardens
item.description: Renowned for their size and stench, blooming corpse flowers are a rare occurrence. But to have four flowering in a week is "something of a record".

item.description: A record number of clutches of white-throated snapping turtles have been found along the Burnett River in Queensland's Bundaberg region.

item.description: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

item.title: Pilbara home to five animal species most impacted by habitat loss, report finds
item.description: The Australian Conservation Foundation says tens of thousands of hectares of land were approved for clearing last year, double that of 2024, putting already endangered species at further risk.

item.title: European troops won't change Trump's ambition for Greenland, says White House
item.description: As European countries send small numbers of troops to Greenland, the White House says their presence will not affect US President Donald Trump's ambitions for the island.

item.title: Daniel Sanders shrugs off broken collarbone to complete 11th stage of Dakar Rally
item.description: Daniel Sanders returns to complete the 11th stage of the Dakar Rally less than 24 hours after suffering a broken collarbone and sternum.

item.title: US says it killed Al Qaeda operative linked to deadly IS ambush of Americans in Syria
item.description: CENTCOM says it conducted a strike in north-west Syria that resulted in the death of an Al Qaeda operative linked to the ISIS gunman responsible for killing two US soldiers and a US civilian in Syria on December 13.

item.title: Taskforce set up to address ongoing power outages across SA from dust pollution
item.description: Ongoing dry conditions across South Australia since 2024 are causing dust and salt to build up across inland and coastal power networks, polluting insulators and leading to mass blackouts.

item.title: Tropical low forecast to bring heavy rain to northern Cape York, Gulf of Carpentaria
item.description: Saturated catchments along the Gulf of Carpentaria and north-west Queensland are bracing for more heavy rain next week, although the weather bureau says the likelihood of a cyclone is low.

item.title: How to attract native wildlife and birds to your garden
item.description: There are simple things we can all do to encourage more native wildlife to our gardens, backyards, balconies and shared spaces.

item.title: As Russia's war intensifies Europe is exploring military and economic independence
item.description: As the world's elite gathered in Davos, European leaders confronted a reality in which they might need to defend themselves, and potentially against, the United States.

item.title: Former state care kid calls for fundamental change to fix 'broken' residential care system
item.description: Residential care is often a last resort for society's most vulnerable children, but being raised by a "system" can leave both physical and emotional scars. It's why those who have gone through it are asking for their voices to be included to reform it.

item.title: Brisbane temperatures tops 35 degrees as Cairns and Townsville face soaking rain
item.description: South-east Queensland is sweating through its hottest Australia Day so far this century, with Brisbane recording its highest maximum temperature since 1998.

item.title: Australia Day heat record for Adelaide, as mercury hits 49C in Ceduna
item.description: As Adelaide sets a new record for its hottest Australia Day, other parts of SA are enduring conditions that are even more sweltering, with the mercury climbing above 49C in Ceduna.

item.description: This scruffy pup has gone from the pound to being part of a scat detection dog team, helping save endangered koalas.

item.description: Brandan Koschel has been charged with publicly inciting hatred on the grounds of race causing fear after he made comments at an open mic session at the rally.

item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology's temperatures differ from those that may be shown in your car or on your phone. Here's how the "official" temperature is measured.

item.description: Firefighters in the Great Southern region of WA are being praised for saving 30 homes after lightning caused a fire that burnt out of control for four days.

item.description: Home owners living beside the Greenbushes lithium mine in Western Australia are calling for a buyback or relocation scheme amid the mounting toll of blasting, dust and noise.

item.description: As the US president faces domestic consequences for his violent immigration crackdown, his geopolitical bluffs across the world also come at a price.

item.description: The worst of the heat has moved into south-west Queensland, while temperatures in the south-east could still hit 40 degrees Celsius before a cooler change early next week.

item.description: A Trump administration push to begin deep-sea mining is gathering momentum — and stirring alarm in United States Pacific territories.

item.description: Deepwater dolphin species make a rare appearance on the NSW Mid North Coast, delighting scientists and marine wildlife enthusiasts.

item.description: Often compared to a "teddy bear", advocates hope the special snap of an endangered flying fox carrying its pup will shine a light on the Christmas Island animal.

item.description: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

item.description: The Kremlin says it sees progress and positive movement in the talks, brokered by the United States, as Donald Trump urges both sides to reach a peace deal.

item.description: Financial counsellors say small businesses struggling to pay debts owed to the tax office are driving calls to Australia's Small Business Debt Helpline higher.

item.title: Terrorist act declaration for Invasion Day attempted bombing shows WA has changed
item.description: It will take time and significant effort to repair relationships with the Indigenous community amid the fallout from last week's attempted bombing in the Perth CBD — but other growing rifts in society will be even harder to mend.

item.description: When was the last time you cleaned your microwave? According to experts, it's actually a lot simpler than cleaning other appliances.

item.title: Adelaide Festival leader Julian Hobba reflects on Writers' Week controversy

item.description: As the last man standing, 78-year-old cattleman Mervyn has parted with his collection of tractors and utes, pledging his estate to charity.

item.description: Extraordinary arrangements are in place in Wellington, New Zealand, as a convicted terrorist prepares to address the country's Court of Appeal.

item.description: Kate Moloney celebrates her 50-game milestone in style as the Australian Diamonds post a 32-goal victory over an understrength Jamaica in Perth.

item.description: The Autonomous Bougainville Government signs a secretive deal to reopen the huge Panguna gold and copper mine that sparked a catastrophic civil war three decades ago.

item.description: The ACT Brumbies have turned up the heat to blitz the Western Force 56-24 in a sapping season-opening Super Rugby Pacific clash in Perth.

item.description: Kal Glanznig had his urine tested as part of an upcoming documentary exploring plastic pollution in Australia. The results left him speechless.

item.description: The Indigenous team overturns a 14-0 deficit to score a rousing comeback win over the Maori in the Women's All Stars clash.

item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.description: An inspired Alex de Minaur produces one of the biggest wins of his career, lifting the Rotterdam Open title by beating red-hot Felix Auger-Aliassime.

item.title: Dams and rivers run dry, forcing Victorian farmers to make tough decisions about their livestock
item.description: Victorian farmers are forced to cart water or destock as dams and rivers run dry.

item.title: DNA recovered from glove found near Guthrie home that appears to match suspect's glove, FBI says
item.description: The FBI says a glove containing DNA was found near the home of US TV show host Savannah Guthrie's mother and appears to match those worn by a masked person outside her front door the night she vanished.

item.title: Sydney scientist collects wild roadside apples to produce cider
item.description: Lucien Alperstein has spent the past decade picking feral apples from trees along country back roads and making cider. They say their guerilla activity inspired their curiosity about the science of genetics and fermentation.

item.title: Antarctic type B killer whales seen for first time near WA's Bremer Bay
item.description: Sightings of Antarctic orcas in Australian waters are very rare. A tour group in WA saw what appeared to be a pod of Antarctic type B killer whales muscle in and steal the meal of a local group of orcas.

item.description: Livigno is an Italian outlier in more ways than one. Already known for its special tax status and fairytale quality, the town has had a phenomenal dumping of snow, causing a significant shuffling of events.

item.description: A woman who hit and killed her partner with her car in 2020 is being pursued for almost $1 million in damages by the Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board.

item.title: WA's illegal tobacco crackdown comes after less than $89,000 in fines issued last year
item.description: Amid moves to increase penalties for those involved in the illegal tobacco trade, Western Australian authorities are slammed for handing out just $88,100 in fines last year.

item.description: A project with dozens of monitoring sites across the Queensland property confirms the presence of the critically endangered plains-wanderer by analysing bird calls.

item.title: Louvre tour guides accused of orchestrating $16m ticket fraud ring over a decade
item.description: Foreign tour guides and staff who were paid to remain silent orchestrated a counterfeit ticketing ring that robbed the Louvre of millions over more than a decade, Parisian prosecutors say.

item.title: Liam Alexander Hall revealed as man charged over alleged terrorism act at Perth Invasion Day rally
item.description: The man accused of throwing a bomb at Invasion Day protesters in an alleged terrorism act attack in Perth can be named as Liam Alexander Hall.

item.title: Man accused of murdering Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics pleads guilty to burglary charge as trial begins
item.description: Lawyers for one of two men on trial for the 1999 murder of Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics tell the ACT Supreme Court he was just the lookout, and had nothing to do with her death.

item.title: Fire crews battle blaze south of Launceston
item.description: The Tasmania Fire Service has downgraded an emergency bushfire warning for an area south of Launceston, with helicopters and ground crews in attendance.

item.title: Mobil Oil Australia to pay $16m fine for misleading claims about fuel sold in Queensland
item.description: The ACCC said Mobil advertised its Mobil Synergy fuel but did not actually supply the product at the time.

item.title: Addin Fonua-Blake and Briton Nikora embrace chance to play State of Origin following eligibility changes
item.description: Cronulla duo Briton Nikora and Addin Fonua-Blake have both praised the rule changes that will give the pair a chance at State of Origin football they thought had long passed them by.

item.title: Sydney’s great fatberg hiding in the sewers
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Grammy-winning songwriter and hitmaker Billy Steinberg dies aged 75
item.description: Award-winning US songwriter Billy Steinberg, who wrote several top hit songs including Madonna's Like a Virgin, died on Monday aged 75, according to media reports.

item.title: Australia knocked out of T20 World Cup with one game left to play
item.description: Australia can no longer catch up with Zimbabwe after it was awarded a point from a rained out match with Ireland.

item.title: Tasmanian salmon industry subject to stricter mortality reporting rules
item.description: Biosecurity Tasmania has introduced stricter requirements for Tasmania's salmon companies reporting on farmed fish deaths — but whether the public finds out is another matter.

item.title: Long-term solution to repeated Waterfall Way landslips on the horizon
item.description: The NSW government hopes to reopen a key east-west transport route by April, as a long-term solution to frequent landslips in the area is explored.

item.title: Matildas expected to name Mary Fowler in Asian Cup squad, injured Charli Grant set to miss out
item.description: Mary Fowler is expected to be named in Australia's Women's Asian Cup squad on Thursday despite having played limited minutes in her return from an ACL injury.

item.title: Telstra accused of environmental breaches in culturally-significant area in SA national park
item.description: Sources say the actions will likely affect Aboriginal communities and that the investigation was not shared with the public.

item.title: Trawool bushfire threat eases but authorities say blaze not yet under control
item.description: Authorities say weather conditions have helped fire crews battling a blaze that threatened homes near Trawool, south of Seymour.

item.title: Federal Court finds factional and 'oppressive' control in South West Aboriginal Medical Service
item.description: A federal court judge has found that two board members factionally controlled a South West Indigenous Medical Service and unfairly expelled members to avoid scrutiny and maintain control.

item.title: Equal time rule leads CBS to pull Stephen Colbert's James Talarico interview
item.description: The Late Show host's on-air revelation that network executives refused to let him interview a Democratic Senate candidate puts a spotlight on how US media outlets treat political coverage.

item.title: Glove found near Nancy Guthrie's home fails to produce DNA match
item.description: The glove resembled a pair worn by an armed man in a ski mask seen in video footage shortly before she was abducted.

item.title: Alcoa hit with record fine for illegally clearing WA jarrah forests for bauxite mine
item.description: US mining giant Alcoa is forced to pay $55 million after unlawfully clearing parts of a Western Australian native forest to mine bauxite.

item.title: Former Coles manager admits 'human error' over Shapes 'Down Down' pricing in federal court showdown
item.description: A former Coles manager has given evidence in the federal court on day three of a bombshell case between the consumer watchdog and supermarket giant.

item.title: Footage shows gunman spraying bullets into suburban home
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police treating spate of Western Sydney shootings and arson attacks as linked
item.description: Raptor Squad detectives are treating three separate incidents as linked to a conflict between two organised criminal networks.

item.title: Australian citizen with ISIS links in Syria hit with exclusion order, federal government says
item.description: The federal government has temporarily banned an Australian citizen linked to ISIS fighters from returning home from Syria.

item.title: Solutions to stop people being radicalised raised at NSW inquiry into right-wing extremism
item.description: Prevention methods to tackle radicalisation are being discussed by experts at a New South Wales inquiry into measures to combat right-wing extremism.

item.title: Claims of 'racist' comment in WA parliament after Chinese New Year event
item.description: WA Labor MPs call on a Nationals member to apologise for what they say was a racist comment directed at one of their colleagues.

item.title: Mechanic rescued after going missing in Queensland outback for almost a week
item.description: A man in his 40s has been rescued after going missing in outback Queensland for almost a week.

item.title: Victoria loses Australian MotoGP with 2026 race to be last in state
item.description: Victoria loses the rights to host the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix, ending a three-decade association with the event.

item.title: Ex-Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila fined $11k over A-League card fixing saga
item.description: Former Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila avoids jail time over his involvement in a card fixing scandal.

item.title: Navy chief's speech disrupted, bomb squad called after rocks thrown through glass door at Canberra hotel
item.description: Officers are looking for two men who fled on bikes after rocks smashed a glass door, halting a defence industry event in Canberra.

item.title: Overnight rain at Kilto Station.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Heavy rainfall in WA's Kimberley sees students go to extra lengths to get to school
item.description: Heavy rainfall in WA's far north has led to some students having to make alternative arrangements to get to school, including using a helicopter.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 12
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Queensland man accused of offering $730 to adopt and abuse overseas children
item.description: A Queensland man accused of offering to pay more than $700 to adopt children overseas so he could have sex with them is refused bail.

item.title: Human remains found during $13.3m construction project in Echuca
item.description: An investigation is underway after bones were found during construction works for a $13.3-million project at Echuca.

item.title: Ex-cop granted bail over alleged stalking following neighbour dispute
item.description: A former Queensland police officer accused of allegedly wearing a balaclava and Easter bonnet to harass and intimidate a neighbouring family has been granted bail.

item.title: Man fined $30,000 for poaching rare snakes from Far North Queensland rainforest
item.description: The court heard Clinton Spiteri was with two others when he visited a rainforest in the Cape York area to steal eight snakes.

item.title: Two Doubleview house fires cause headaches for firefighters
item.description: Emergency services extinguish two separate house fires in close proximity to each other in Doubleview in Perth's north.

item.title: Firefighters had to work quickly to bring two house fires in Doubleview under control.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police arrest almost 60 people over unrest in NT community of Wadeye
item.description: Northern Territory police have arrested 58 people in relation to weeks of unrest in the remote Top End community, which has seen brawls involving up to a few hundred of people — some of them armed — spilling out onto the streets.

item.title: South Australia could host the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix from 2027
item.description: An announcement on the future of the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix is expected as soon as tomorrow amid widespread speculation the event is set to shift to South Australia.

item.title: Sisonke Msimang picked up what police said was an explosive device at Perth Invasion Day rally, gave it to them and waited for a slow response
item.description: When Sisonke picked up a device that looked like a glass jar in Perth on Australia Day, she had a sense of foreboding so she took it to police. She says they took some time to act.

item.title: Driver charged over Camden fatal crash escaped Cumberland Hospital mental health care before incident
item.description: A driver charged over a double-fatal crash used a staff pass to escape hospital the day before an alleged Sydney stabber fled the same mental health facility.
